title: As a user I want to view the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788806/Data+Discovery+-+Elect+Free+Agency+Widget

Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_

Acceptance Criteria: 
* A Free Agency tab can be found, in alpha order, on the Transactions tab. 
* The Elect Free Agency - XX(B) widget is found at the top of the tab, with its own unique permission set. 
* If a user does not have this permission set, they do not see the tab. This will be a BOC only widget.
* There is a "Load Default Players" button. Clicking that will load the widget according to the data discovery and wireframe. 
* The widget columns will follow the layout of the wireframe and the provided data discovery. (Population of the widget and columns will come with followup stories)

title: As a user I want the Elect Free Agency widget to be populated with potential MJ Free Agents
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Elect+Free+Agency+Widget

Predicted FA Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-TXT-5215+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The default player population for the widget should match that of the Predicted Free Agent Filings report.
 - All players with a current MAJ contract with an expiration date of the current league year. OR Any players with an option in their current MAJ contract that would make them a FA
* Default sort should be on player Last, secondary sort on First. 
* Player's name should be a hyperlink to their Player History. 
* Contract Start Year should be a hyperlink to the associated MJ Contract.

title: As a user I want to be able to add a player to the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be an Add Player button on the widget
AND clicking this button should add a new row to the widget
AND the user should have the ability to select an existing player from the system (All players with a current Confirmed Terms or higher MJ Contract should appear as an option)
AND selecting a player in the widget will populate the relevant information for them in the remaining columns
AND the player should be committed to the widget on "Save"

title: As a user I want to be able to remove a player from the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_


Acceptance Criteria: 
* There should be a trash can icon on each row in the widget. 
* Clicking the trash can icon should remove the player from the widget. 
* Clicking "Save" should remove the player from the population. 
* If changes are cancelled then the player should NOT be removed.

title: As a user I want to be able to Reset the player population in the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Elect+Free+Agency+Widget

Predicted FA Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-TXT-5215+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Reset to Default" button. 
* Clicking this button will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their edits and refresh the player population.
* Any of the manual edits made to the list will be cleared if the user confirms.

title: As a user I want to be able to hold a player back from being elected as a FA in the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a checkbox for each player included on the widget.
AND checking the checkbox for a player and clicking "Save" will cause the checkmark to persist.
AND if the "Approve" button is clicked, the players with the "hold" checkbox chekced will not have EFA transactions created

title: As a user I want to be able to save changes to the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_


Acceptance Criteria: 
* If no edits have been made to the widget, the Save button is there, but disabled.
* As soon as any edits have been made, the Save button enables.
* Clicking Save will commit any changes made up until this point and display a blue successful save notification. 
* There is a Cancel button available on the screen that also is disabled until an edit has been made.
* As soon as any edits have been made, the Cancel button enables.  
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose all of their edits. Confirming will refresh the screen to the last saved version of the form. If they don't confirm, the changes will persist.

title: As a user I want to be able to approve an Elect Free Agency XXB transactions for all of the players in the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_

Elect Free Agency Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/13.+Elect+Free+Agency
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the "Elect Free Agency XXB" widget
custom_expected:
THERE should be an "Approve" button on the widget
AND clicking this button will allow the user to enter the election date to be used for all of the current players
AND after entering the date, the user should have the ability to confirm that they want to elect FA for the # of players in the widget
AND confirming will attempt to create and auto-approve an Elect Free Agency transaction for each player that is on the widget that does NOT currently have the "hold" checkmark checked or a pending tx.
AND the system will run through the entire population of the players before displaying any error messages or confirmation
AND all of the ELect Free Agency rules will run as usual for each transaction. The Elect Free Agency type will set to XX(B) for each player, with the election date = the date entered by the user. All regular On Approve updates should be made for the player.
AND once the last player has been proceessed, the system will display a confirmation message with the number of players successfully elected, along with a list of the errors encountered
AND the widget should refresh to only display players who were not successfully processed, as well as any players that were held back.

title: As a user I want to be able to export the MJ Elect Free Agency utility
custom_preconds:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Elect Free Agency XX(B) utility, there is an Export button. 
* Clicking the "Export" button will allow the user to select whether they wish to export to excel or to pdf. 
* Selecting pdf will download a pdf of the current population of the utility into a pdf, with the additional column of Player ID. 
* Selecting excel will download a .xls file of the current population of the utility, with the additional column of Player ID.

title: As a user I want to be able to view batch results from the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Results" widget on the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process batch screen.
* By default the widget contains the results of the last batch that is included in the screen that was run. 
* The columns for the batch should match those of the columns available for the batch if it were run from its individual batch screen. 
* The header of the Results widget should include the batch's name and run information (See wire)
* Clicking on any of the individual rows within the Batch History widget should reload the Results widget with the correct information (including the different columns sets and the header information).

title: As a user I want to be able to view batch run information from the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process screen, there is a "Batch History" widget at the bottom of the page with a complete history of all of the runs of each of the 3 batches contained in the process. 
  - The Nightly Minor League Free Agents batch
  - The Declare MN Free Agents batch
  - The Potential Minor League Free Agents batch

title: As a user I want to see all the batches necessary for the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process together in one screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under "Transactions" on the batch screen there should be a "Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process" option. 
* Clicking on this name will take the user to a screen as displayed in the wireframe. 
* The screen will match the wireframe (any actual functionality and population of the widgets is handled in follow up stories, along with the Run Report button). 
* A Close button is available. 
* Clicking Close will return the user to the main batch screen.

title: As a user I want to be able to run each of the batches from the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility&c=1
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=batch_running

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There will be a "Run" button for each of the batches on the screen as well as a dropdown where the user can select which mode to run each batch in (Report, Test and Update). 
* Clicking "Run" for any of the batches will run the relevant batch in the selected mode.
* While any one of these three batches in progress (not others in the system), the other "Run" buttons will disable and the batch currently running will display an "Abort" button in red instead. (see 2nd wire)
* The batch that is currently running will display a progress bar to indicate to the user how far along the current batch is (just like if this were run for the batch from its individual batch screen). 
* Clicking "Abort" for the batch being run will abort the currently running batch and re-enable all of the run buttons.

title: As a user I want to run the Declare MN Free Agents batch
custom_preconds:
Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Declare+MN+Free+Agents

Declare MNFA Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Declare+MN+Free+Agent

Wires (generic): 
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contrat_expiration
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=global_results_widget

Acceptance Criteria
* "Declare MN Free Agents" is a batch option under the "Transactions" section on the batch screen.
* Clicking "Declare MN Free Agents" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
* The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
* A "Run" button is available. 
* Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
* Running the batch will find all of the players that are eligible to be made minor league free agents and auto-create and approve a Declare MN Free Agent transaction for them. 
* All On Approve rules and updates for the Declare MN Free Agent transaction will be run for each player. 
* Any player who is declared a MN Free agent during the batch should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Player ID, Player's Name, Org, Club, MJ Roster Status and MN Roster Status. 
* Sort of the Batch Results widget should be on Errors (All errors should be at the top), then Org, then Club, then player name (last, first). 
* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Minor League Free Agent reports from the Declare MN FA process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Run Reports" button on the Yearly Minor League Free Agent process screen. 
* Clicking this button launches a dropdown for the user to select which report they wish to run. 
* The options are "Potential MN League Free Agents" and "Declared MN Free Agents". 
* Selecting either option will open the BO prompt for the report, allowing the user to select whatever prompts they want and run the report from there (should open in a new window).

title: As a user I want to be able to view Potential MnFA Year Batch results from the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility

*AC are the same - just revisiting this story to make sure that they work with the addition of the new batch*

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Results" widget on the Yearly Minor League Free Agent Process batch screen.
* By default the widget contains the results of the last batch that is included in the screen that was run. 
* The columns for the batch should match those of the columns available for the batch if it were run from its individual batch screen. 
* The header of the Results widget should include the batch's name and run information (See wire)
* Clicking on any of the individual rows within the Batch History widget should reload the Results widget with the correct information (including the different columns sets and the header information).

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Potential MnFA Year Batch from the Yearly Minor League Free Agent process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility&c=1
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=batch_running

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Potential MnFA Year Batch should be added as step 3 and the Declare MN Free Agents batch moved to step 4. 
* It will have a "Run" button as well as a dropdown where the user can select which mode to run each batch in (Report, Test and Update). 
* Clicking "Run"  will run the relevant batch in the selected mode.
* While any one of these four batches in progress (not others in the system), the other "Run" buttons will disable and the batch currently running will display an "Abort" button in red instead. (see 2nd wire)
* The batch that is currently running will display a progress bar to indicate to the user how far along the current batch is (just like if this were run for the batch from its individual batch screen). 
* Clicking "Abort" for the batch being run will abort the currently running batch and re-enable all of the run buttons.

title: Submit an elect free agency to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an "Elect Free Agency" Transaction has been created
AND "Elect under Article" is set to XXD or another option that is available to clubs
custom_expected:
THEN the tx status will update to "Submitted to BOC"
AND a blue notification will display
AND the system will set the player's pending Org and Club to NULL
AND the system will set the player's pending Major League Rosters status to "Free Agent"

title: BOC user can approve an elect free agency transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there is an "Elect Free Agency" tx 
AND is in view or edit mode in a state of Preliminary, Submitted to BOC and Rejected
custom_expected:
THEN the tx status is updated to "Approved"
AND a blue notification is displayed
AND the item is removed from the approvals clipboard
AND the player's MJR or MNR status is set to Free Agent
AND the player's Org and Club is set to Null

title: View an existing Elect Free Agency transaction
custom_preconds: Given there is an existing Elect Free Agency Tx
custom_steps: WHEN clicking on the tx in a player's Player History
custom_expected: THEN the tx will open in view mode

title: Create a new Elect Free Agency tx for a player from their Player History
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on a player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN selecting "Elect Free Agency" from the "Create New" menu
custom_expected: THEN the system will load a new Preliminary tx

title: Submit an elect free agency to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN an "Elect Free Agency" Transaction has been created
custom_expected:
THEN the tx status will update to "Submitted to BOC"
AND a blue notification will display
AND the system will set the player's pending Org and Club to NULL
AND the system will set the player's pending Major League Rosters status to "Free Agent"

title: Error if attempting to elect a player under article XXB with an invalid election date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN "Election Under Article" is set to "XXB" 
AND the Election Date is before 
AND is no more than 5 days after the World Series End Date
custom_expected: THEN an error will display "Electing FA under XXB must be within 5 days of FA filing period (between {date 1} and {date 2})"

title: BOC user can reject an elect free agency transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there is an "Elect Free Agency" tx 
AND is in a state, Submitted to BOC
custom_expected:
THEN the status will update to "Rejected"
AND a blue notification will display
AND the item will be removed from the approvals clipboard
AND reverse player's Pending org and club, pending MJ Roster Status and Pending MN Roster Status
AND remove pending player history entry.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse and suppress an elect free agency transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is a BOC user
AND there is an elect free agency tx in an Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN the tx will first reverse, and then be suppressed
AND the tx will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches, and any other place where it is visible on UI

title: BOC user while approving an elect free agency will expire a player's major league contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is a BOC user
AND there is a Elect Free Agency tx pending approval
custom_expected:
THEN the player's current MJC will expire
AND player's current major contract status updates to 'Expired'
AND an automatic comment generated on the contract (should not overwrite existing text but add to existing text). 
        "Expired by [username] on [date, time stamp] via [transaction name - article name]"

title: BOC user can reverse an elect free agency transaction to un-expire any major league contracts that were expired as a result of the elect free agency transaction being approved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AND there is an Elect Free Agency tx in Approved state
custom_steps: WHEN the state of the tx is moved to Reversed
custom_expected:
THEN the MJC that was marked Expired as a result of the approval of the tx will "unexpire"
AND the state of the major league contract will be returned to its previous state

title: BOC user can create a new Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3) transaction for a player from their Player History
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AND "Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3)" is an option from the Create New menu
custom_steps: WHEN selecting "Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3)" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary, Submitted or Rejected Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3) transaction for the same player created within 10 days of the current date.
custom_expected: THEN the system will load a new Preliminary tx

title: Warning if attempting to create the accepted qualifying offer transaction for a player that does not have a recent Elect Free Agency - XX(B) transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN a player does not have an approved or submitted Elect Free Agency with a "Election Under Article" set to XXB with an Election Date within the past 10 days
custom_steps: WHEN selecting "Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3)" from the Create New menu
custom_expected: THEN a warning will display "Player does not have an Elect Free Agency â€“ XX(B) within 10 days."

title: Submit an Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3) to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN an "Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3)" Transaction has been created
custom_expected:
THEN the tx status will update to "Submitted to BOC"
AND a blue notification will display
AND the player's Player History: Code = AQXOB, Description = Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3), From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields in green font
AND a approval item will be generated

title: BOC user can reverse and suppress an Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3) transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is a BOC user
AND there is a "Accepted Qualifying Offer Under Article XX(B)(3)" tx in an Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN the tx will first reverse, and then be suppressed
AND the tx will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches, and any other place where it is visible on UI
